D3 Security provides the world's leading platform for security orchestration, automation, incident response, and investigation/case management. Today more than 1000 organizations - including over 100 of the Fortune 500 rely on D3 to build, automate and execute incident response plans, connect with third-party technologies and apply data-driven decisions across an enterprise-wide vision of incidents, investigations, and risk. Core components of the D3 platform include integrations with SIEM and threat intelligence platforms, a NIST-compliant playbook library, a robust case management module for guided investigations, and award-winning analytics toolsets. The results are organized and filterable intelligence streams that empower organizations with streamlined security operations, deeper analytical insights, and automation-powered playbooks with granular task profiles.
What you will be doing:
Support/Enhance product software and firmware build systems.
Evaluate and document software tools and provide an in-depth analysis.
Manage, enhance and maintain automated test systems.
Assist with diagnosis, performance of root cause analysis, and problem repair.
Participate in daily Scrums, sprint planning, and story estimating activities.
Identify, integrate and coordinate maintenance and enhancement efforts with team members and with other teams.
Collaborate with product and system test teams to improve the delivery/release processes.

Understanding of Configuration Management of computer systems.
Networking and related equipment.
Virtual machines on Windows or Linux Systems
Containerization on Windows or Linux Systems
Working knowledge of scripting languages.
Working knowledge of Windows and/or Linux Operating Systems.
Understanding of metrics collection, reporting and monitoring tools.
Test Automation and related tool sets.
Automated deployment and release processes.
Nice-to-Have
Understanding of Agile and DevOps values and principles.
Understanding of Systems development as it relates to the writing, testing, deployment and release processes of software and software systems and the infrastructure required to support those activities.
Understanding of software version control systems, continuous integration servers and binary repositories.
Ability to investigate, identify and repair technical issues.
Willingness to think outside the box and find innovative solutions to complex issues.
Strong and effective written and verbal communication abilities.
Ability to work in a team environment or work independently.
Ability and willingness to quickly learn new technologies, new processes and new skills.

Minimum 2 year-degree or diploma in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
Strong technical and testing skills including:
Design and programming or scripting skills, including 2+ years of experience programming with the following: Python, C#, SQL

What success looks like in this role:
Key Responsibilities
Respond to technical service hardware repair requests on enterprise-level servers, PC and laptop computers, storage sub-systems and drives and networking devices at client locations in the area.
Installs, maintains, troubleshoots and repairs/replaces hardware components on a variety of equipment which may include enterprise servers, mainframe, networking, storage-subsystems and drives, telecommunications equipment, high-end document processing equipment, peripherals and PCs.
Provides deskside support including software, hardware and networking support for desktops, laptops and servers.
Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction and takes responsibility for additional follow-up, testing and troubleshooting services or problem escalation.
Maintains professionalism in actions, demeanor and dress.
You will be successful in this role if you have:
High school diploma or GED required. Background investigation required.
Must have valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle with appropriate insurance.
2+ years of experience in an enterprise field service support role providing break/fix hardware repair for a variety of vendor server, mass storage, desktop, core legacy and networking devices.
Ability to troubleshoot and repair enterprise-level software, hardware and operating system issues. Must be knowledgeable on various Microsoft operating systems and desktop applications.
Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills to work effectively with internal and external customers. Excellent problem solving skills.
A+ certification required. HPE, Cisco, Dell and EMC certifications are highly desired
Must be available for after-hours on-call rotation. Must be available for varying shifts on a rotating basis.
